title: federate owncloud instances
body:
hello everyone!

thanks for doing owncloud, it’s an awesome piece of software! in reply to my comment on a blog entry (https://owncloud.com/blog/one-server-per-person-a-highly-decentralized-cloud) frank suggested that i should open an issue here, so here we go.

since people are encouraged to have their own personal clouds, they can’t share the data over/with a community. so far there are two options to share data with other people. giving them a login for the cloud or sharing via links.

a great feature would be to share with other (own)clouds. in a workflow that could mean that you add another (own)cloud to your trusted/known/networked clouds. then, whenever you want to share something, owncloud also checks the user databases of the other known (own)clouds (or frequently syncs them) and offers you to share the data with them. even better would be that you can group said users or share with all users of another cloud.

in a simple version, people could log in to owncloud (a) with something like username@cloud.other.net (b) and see shared data or even upload their own. that could work via a simple soap interface (cloud a sends the login to cloud b, which replies with success or failed) or even shibboleth (which, as a nice by-product, would allow login with general shibboleth servers, making owncloud it a great product for larger institutions like universities).

in a better and more complex version, the clouds even share the data, meaning that the users log in to their own cloud and see the shared data of other clouds.

again, thanks for creating owncloud.

adios
oliver
